intro: Rourea neglecta, commonly known as the neglected rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or yellowish and appear in clusters. Rourea neglecta is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
